target_content: Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
justification: The implementation of TA6.29 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.28, as the restoration of terrestrial ecosystems can lead to increased carbon sequestration, which can contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions from transportation.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of sea areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
justification: The implementation of TA6.30 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.29, as the restoration of marine ecosystems can lead to increased carbon sequestration, which can contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions from transportation.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition.
justification: The implementation of TA6.31 may have a negative impact on TA5.3, as the restoration of ecosystems may require the use of fertilizers, which can lead to increased nutrient losses.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types.
justification: The implementation of TA6.32 may have a negative impact on TA5.4, as the restoration of ecosystems may require the use of pesticides, which can lead to increased use of more hazardous pesticides.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures for the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species listed in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC.
justification: The implementation of TA6.33 may have a negative impact on TA5.5, as the restoration of ecosystems may require the use of pesticides, which can lead to increased use and risk of chemical pesticides.

target_content: Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters.
justification: The implementation of TA6.34 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.8, as the removal of artificial barriers can lead to improved water quality and increased water availability, which can contribute to preserving freshwater.

target_content: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90% is in good condition.
justification: The implementation of TA6.35 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.9, as the increase of habitat area in good condition can lead to increased biodiversity, which can contribute to achieving the target of increasing organic farming.

target_content: Urban ecosystems. By 2030, Member States shall ensure that there is no net loss in the total national area of urban green space.
justification: The implementation of TA6.36 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.10, as the preservation of urban green space can lead to increased energy efficiency, which can contribute to reducing energy consumption in the agriculture and food sector.

target_content: Urban ecosystems. Member States shall achieve thereafter an increasing trend in the total national area of urban green space.
justification: The implementation of TA6.37 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.11, as the increase of urban green space can lead to increased energy efficiency, which can contribute to reducing energy consumption in the agriculture and food sector.

target_content: Urban ecosystems. Member States shall achieve, in each urban ecosystem area, an increasing trend of urban tree canopy cover.
justification: The implementation of TA6.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.11, as the increase of urban tree canopy cover can lead to increased energy efficiency, which can contribute to reducing energy consumption in the agriculture and food sector.

target_content: Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters.
justification: The implementation of TA6.39 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.30, as the removal of artificial barriers can lead to improved water quality and increased water availability, which can contribute to achieving the target of deploying shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels.

target_content: Pollinator
impact_target: Member States shall, by putting in place in a timely manner appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations.
column6: The implementation of TA6.40 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.6, as the improvement of pollinator diversity can lead to increased pollination services, which can contribute to achieving the target of increasing sustainable fishing and aquaculture.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve [...] areas of habitat types listed in Annex II which are not in good condition.
justification: The implementation of TA6.41 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.6, as the restoration of marine ecosystems can lead to increased biodiversity, which can contribute to achieving the target of increasing sustainable fishing and aquaculture.

target_content: Ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types of groups 1-6 listed in Annex II in areas not covered by those habitat types.
justification: The implementation of TA6.42 may have a negative impact on TA5.7, as the restoration of ecosystems may require the use of resources, which can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture, fisheries, and aquaculture.

target_content: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1â€“6 of Annex II.
justification: The implementation of TA6.43 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.8, as the improvement of knowledge on marine ecosystems can lead to better management and conservation of these ecosystems, which can contribute to preserving freshwater.

target_content: Agricultural ecosystems
impact_target: Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least two out of the three following indicators in agricultural ecosystems.
column6: The implementation of TA6.44 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.9, as the improvement of indicators in agricultural ecosystems can lead to increased organic farming, which can contribute to achieving the target of increasing organic farming.

target_content: Agricultural ecosystems
impact_target: Member States shall put in place restoration measures which shall aim to ensure that the common farmland bird index at national level based on the species specified in Annex V reaches the following levels.
column6: The implementation of TA6.45 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.10, as the improvement of farmland bird index can lead to increased biodiversity, which can contribute to achieving the target of increasing energy efficiency in the agriculture and food sector.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles.
justification: The implementation of TA4.28 may have a negative impact on TA6.36, as the deployment of recharging stations can lead to increased urbanization and loss of urban green space.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles.
justification: The implementation of TA4.29 may have a negative impact on TA6.37, as the deployment of recharging points can lead to increased urbanization and loss of urban green space.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node.
justification: The implementation of TA4.30 may have a negative impact on TA6.38, as the deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations can lead to increased urbanization and loss of urban tree canopy cover.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations with a total capacity of at least 1 tonne per day, and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser, are deployed at least every 200 km along the TEN-T.
justification: The implementation of TA4.31 may have a negative impact on TA6.39, as the deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations can lead to increased urbanization and loss of natural connectivity of rivers.

target_content: States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029.
justification: The implementation of TA4.32 may have a negative impact on TA6.40, as the deployment of electricity supply to stationary aircraft can lead to increased energy consumption and pollution, which can negatively impact pollinators.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025.
justification: The implementation of TA4.33 may have a negative impact on TA6.41, as the deployment of shore-side electricity supply can lead to increased energy consumption and pollution, which can negatively impact marine ecosystems.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports.
justification: The implementation of TA4.34 may have a negative impact on TA6.42, as the deployment of shore-side electricity supply can lead to increased energy consumption and pollution, which can negatively impact ecosystems.

target_content: Zero-emission in urban logistics
justification: The implementation of TA4.55 may have a negative impact on TA6.44, as the deployment of zero-emission urban logistics can lead to increased energy consumption and pollution, which can negatively impact agricultural ecosystems.

target_content: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
justification: The implementation of TA5.2 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.31, as the reduction of antimicrobials can lead to improved ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of restoring terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems.

target_content: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility.
justification: The implementation of TA5.3 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.32, as the reduction of nutrient losses can lead to improved soil fertility, which can contribute to achieving the target of re-establishing habitat types.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
justification: The implementation of TA5.4 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.33, as the reduction of hazardous pesticides can lead to improved ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of restoring terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides
justification: The implementation of TA5.5 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.34, as the reduction of chemical pesticides can lead to improved ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of ensuring natural connectivity of rivers.

target_content: Aquatic living resources: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture.
justification: The implementation of TA5.6 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.40, as the increase of sustainable fishing and aquaculture can lead to improved pollinator diversity, which can contribute to achieving the target of improving pollinator diversity.

target_content: Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030.
justification: The implementation of TA5.7 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.41, as the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved marine ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of restoring marine ecosystems.

target_content: Water: Preserving freshwater, boosting water reuse in agriculture.
justification: The implementation of TA5.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.42, as the preservation of freshwater can lead to improved ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of re-establishing habitat types.

target_content: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030
justification: The implementation of TA5.9 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.43, as the increase of organic farming can lead to improved knowledge on marine ecosystems, which can contribute to achieving the target of ensuring the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types.

target_content: Energy: Increase renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector.
justification: The implementation of TA5.10 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.44, as the increase of renewable energy can lead to improved agricultural ecosystem health, which can contribute to achieving the target of achieving an increasing trend at national level of at least two out of the three following indicators.

target_content: Biodiversity conservation and restoration of natural resources: Protect the environment and restore natural resources.
justification: The implementation of TA5.11 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.45, as the protection and restoration of natural resources can lead to improved farmland bird index, which can contribute to achieving the target of ensuring the common farmland bird index at national level reaches the following levels.
